page.title: 04Coal in the Dinnington area
page.content: The first colliery in Dinnington was opened in 1867 soon followed by others in the area and the{COAL INDUSTRY} flourished,it was a major employer. Coal was mined by tunnelling under the ground to the coal seams. In the 1960's with the decline of{COAL}the collieries gradually closed leaving open only {BRENKLEY,}a DRIFT MINE first opened in 1953, however this too will close in 1986 with a loss of even more jobs in an area of high unemployment. {OPENCAST COAL}has been worked for some time around{DINNINGTON top soil,rocks and shale are removed to expose the COAL seams which are then worked in the open.In the 1984/85 miners strike work stopped and it has not started again. When{BRENKLEY} closes and the{OPENCAST COAL PROJECT } is concluded many years of{COAL}in the {DINNINGTON}area will come to an end.
